purpose: Replaces characters in a string by location.
titleCardParagraphs: There are several formulas in Excel designed to help you replace characters in a string.
The REPLACE function in Excel replaces characters in a string by location.
The SUBSTITUTE function in Excel replaces chracters in string by finding matching substrings.

paragraphs: In Excel, you can use the REPLACE function to replace specific characters in a string by location. For example, to replace the first three characters of a string with 'ABC', you'd use the formula =REPLACE(A1, 1, 3, 'ABC').

syntaxTable.description: The original text or the text which contains the characters you want to replace.
The starting position of the character in old_text you want to replace. The first position in text is 1.
The number of characters in old_text that you want to replace. If omitted, it will replace all characters from start_num to the end of old_text.
The text string that will replace the characters in old_text.

examplesTable.description: Replaces the text 'World' with 'Pandas' starting at the 7th position.

Replaces two characters starting from the 3rd position with 'XY'.

codeSections.title: Substituting specific values in a column
paragraphs: To replace specific values in a column in Excel, you'd use the 'Find & Replace' feature or the SUBSTITUTE formula instead of the REPLACE functionality.
Instead of replacing characters by location, the SUBSTITUTE formula replaces characters by finding matching substrings. To do the same in Pandas, you can use the replace method.

paragraphs: The string slicing method that we use above only works on string columns. If you try to use it on a numeric column, you'll get an error.
To avoid this, you can convert the column to a string using the astype method.

codeSections.title: Replacing by value
paragraphs: The string slicing method is useful when you want to replace a specific number of characters from the front, end or middle of a string. However, if you want to replace a specific value, you can use the replace method directly.
To learn more about the replace method, refer to the SUBSITUTE page.
